kp9:6.1: Nikujjati means to “turn upside down”, most familiar in the case of when the Sangha in extreme circumstances to “upturn the bowl” (pattaṁ nikujjati). Most translators follow the comm. here (vañceyya, “trick, deceive”). However Ñāṇamoḷi has “work another’s undoing”. I think the sense is that one should not turn away from or avert one’s gaze from another.
